pullRequest.title: DEVX-2187: Convert "Lookups" recipe to KT
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description
A while back I had a discussion with @ybyzek and @bbejeck about recipe to KT conversions. At the time we all decided that the lookups recipe was almost identical to the join-stream-table KT, minus the fact that the KT didn't use the verbiage "lookups". Reading through the KT, I personally think the only edits that need to be made are to the title, question, and index link to the KT.
I am curious to hear y'alls thoughts.
Also happy to sneak in some short answers in this PR while I'm at it, just say the word!
No docs related to testing were altered in this PR.
Staging Docs
http://kafka-tutorials-staging.s3-website-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/DEVX-2187
http://kafka-tutorials-staging.s3-website-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/DEVX-2187/join-a-stream-to-a-table/ksql.html

nodes.bodyText: @awalther28 awesome touch to augment meta-description as well, since that text may sometimes be surfaced in Google search results, which in turn impacts SEO and CTR.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -43,10 +43,10 @@ merging:
     kafka: enabled
 
 joining-stream-table:
-  title: "How to join a stream and a table together"
-  meta-description: "Learn to join a stream and a table together"
+  title: "How to join a stream and a lookup table together"
+  meta-description: "Learn to join a stream and a lookup table together"

commit.message: DEVX-2187: add blurb about kafka connect + databases

nodes.bodyText: @awalther28 for symmetry to the other KTs listed below this one, what do you think about removing lookup from here?  (Leaving lookup in the KT itself)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -101,7 +101,7 @@

Apache Kafka is a powerful, scalable, fault-tolerant distri
Join data.
    -
  • Join a stream and a table
    • +
  • Join a stream and a lookup table

nodes.bodyText: @awalther28 awesome text.  Given that there's also a kstreams KT (for both this KT and the JDBC KT), maybe this text should also be added to _includes/tutorials/joining-stream-table/kstreams?  (with slight modification :%s/ksqlDB/Kafka Streams/)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -2,4 +2,6 @@ First, you'll need to create a Kafka topic and table to represent the movie refe +++++ 
{% include_raw tutorials/joining-stream-table/ksql/code/tutorial-steps/dev/create-movies-table.sql %}
-+++++ \ No newline at end of file ++++++ + +In this case the lookup data originates from a Kafka topic but this doesn't always have to be the case. You can use Kafka Connect to stream data from a source system (such as a database) into a Kafka topic, which could then be the foundation for your ksqlDB lookup table. For further reading checkout this tutorial on link:https://kafka-tutorials.confluent.io/connect-add-key-to-source/ksql.html[creating a ksqlDB table from PostgresSQL data using Kafka Connect].

commit.message: DEVX-2187: add call out to JDBC connector in kstreams
DEVX-2187: use note to broadly talk about populating data ksqlDB

nodes.bodyText:
@awalther28 FYC, feel free to ignore if you intentionally chose the console producer

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            This tutorial uses ksqlDB `INSERT INTO VALUES` syntax. For an example on how to use the Apache Kafka® clients to write data to the underlying topics, see link:https://kafka-tutorials.confluent.io/kafka-console-consumer-producer-basics/kafka.html[*Kafka console producer basics*] and for an example on how to use connectors to source data from external systems, see link:https://kafka-tutorials.confluent.io/connect-add-key-to-source/ksql.html[*creating a ksqlDB table from PostgresSQL data using Kafka Connect*].
          
          
            
            This tutorial uses ksqlDB `INSERT INTO VALUES` syntax. For an example on how to use the Apache Kafka® clients to write data to the underlying topics, see link:https://kafka-tutorials.confluent.io/creating-first-apache-kafka-producer-application/kafka.html[*building your first Kafka producer application*] and for an example on how to use connectors to source data from external systems, see link:https://kafka-tutorials.confluent.io/connect-add-key-to-source/ksql.html[*creating a ksqlDB table from PostgresSQL data using Kafka Connect*].
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -2,4 +2,16 @@ In a similar manner, populate the ratings stream: +++++ 
{% include_raw tutorials/joining-stream-table/ksql/code/tutorial-steps/dev/populate-ratings.sql %}
-+++++ \ No newline at end of file ++++++ + +[NOTE] +.Populating Data +==== +One fundamental operation for working with tables is populating them with data. There are a number of ways to do this: + + * Use ksqlDB's `INSERT INTO VALUES` syntax. + * Use the Apache Kafka® clients to write data to the underlying topics. + * Use connectors to source data from external systems. + +This tutorial uses ksqlDB `INSERT INTO VALUES` syntax. For an example on how to use the Apache Kafka® clients to write data to the underlying topics, see link:https://kafka-tutorials.confluent.io/kafka-console-consumer-producer-basics/kafka.html[*Kafka console producer basics*] and for an example on how to use connectors to source data from external systems, see link:https://kafka-tutorials.confluent.io/connect-add-key-to-source/ksql.html[*creating a ksqlDB table from PostgresSQL data using Kafka Connect*].
